channel.title: Upload to webs
channel.description:
can someone tell me how i upload my files for my webclient to webs.com
add me on msn : ikbenk0z@live.nl

item.title: Upload to webs
item.dc:creator: @frenkerscape frenkerscape
item.description:
@frenkerscape wrote:

[quote=“djmeadows88, post:4, topic:388091”]There is more to it than that. Upload the client.jar into your filemanager, after this you go to the webpage editor of the page you are wanting to put your Webclient onto, then you click add content, and you erase everything in the two boxes, after this click on the paragraph box, now go up to the top and find HTML, and when you do that copy and paste this code in the box [code]

Your Webclient [/code]

Now you change yourclientname and your webclient to your Webclient/Clients name. And if you did not save your jar file as client.jar then you change “client.jar” to the name of your client.jar. Now you click publish, and then publish all and load the webpage and if that doesn’t work then you have done something wrong.[/quote]when i click on content box it says a error

Read full topic

item.title: Upload to webs
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

djmeadows88:

They have always allowed custom htmls. If they didnt allow custom HTMLS then there would not be any webclients on Webs.com sites.

A few years ago (2006 ish) it was freewebs, and you couldn’t add raw HTML pages. you had to use their “HTML Studio” that was kind of a WYSIWYG thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Upload to webs
item.dc:creator: @djmeadows88 djmeadows88
item.description:
@djmeadows88 wrote:

There is more to it than that. Upload the client.jar into your filemanager, after this you go to the webpage editor of the page you are wanting to put your Webclient onto, then you click add content, and you erase everything in the two boxes, after this click on the paragraph box, now go up to the top and find HTML, and when you do that copy and paste this code in the box [code]

Your Webclient [/code]

Now you change yourclientname and your webclient to your Webclient/Clients name. And if you did not save your jar file as client.jar then you change “client.jar” to the name of your client.jar. Now you click publish, and then publish all and load the webpage and if that doesn’t work then you have done something wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Upload to webs
item.dc:creator: @frenkerscape frenkerscape
item.description:
@frenkerscape wrote:

[quote=“Aceron4, post:2, topic:388091”]When you are editing your website, under “Manage Pages” you should see the tab “File Manager”

Just click “Single File Uploader” and your good to go.[/quote]i know but it wont work i do something wrong with the files

Read full topic

item.title: Upload to webs
item.dc:creator: @Aceron4 Aceron4
item.description:
@Aceron4 wrote:

When you are editing your website, under “Manage Pages” you should see the tab “File Manager”

Just click “Single File Uploader” and your good to go.

Read full topic
